question:
You recently bought a piece of equipment for your kitchen but it did not work. You phoned the shop but no action was taken.
Write a letter to the shop manager. In your letter:
•	describe the problem with the equipment
•	explain what happened when you phoned the shop
•	say what you would like the manager to do
text: I am writing to you regarding the microwave that I purchased on 16th October, 2019 from your department stores at Utako branch which is not functioning. This equipment cannot be used because the start button is stiff. Consequently, I cannot power it on despite the fact that the plug is functioning.

In order to rectify this issue, I called the help lines which I saw on the receipt and Mr. Pedro advised me on what to do. The first step was to send a snapshot of the receipt that was issued to me after a successful purchase. Furthermore, he also advised me to send a complaint letter to this email: [email protected] for verification. Unfortunately, they neither responded to my complaint mail, nor resolved the issue, despite the fact that I followed his instruction,

However, I would appreciate it if you would give me a new replacement since I have not used the product. Besides that, I believe I am entitled to this because the warranty policy said complaint must be made within 3 days of purchase.
Thank you for your time while I await a positive feedback from you.

It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The word help lines seems to be miswritten. Consider replacing it.
The abbreviated title Mr. seems to be punctuated incorrectly. Consider changing the punctuation.
The comma before the conjunction nor appears to be unnecessary. Consider removing it.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The indefinite article, a, may be redundant when used with the uncountable noun feedback in your sentence. Consider removing it.
